summary.p: Although he has already declined the offer to enter the service of Count Georg of Württemberg once with many reasons, he will now - also for Bullinger's sake - continue to negotiate.

div.p: Gracious, dear sir, although I believed, based on my previous declining response, when I was asked by Count Georg of Württemberg, my gracious lord, to enter his service, that I would not be asked again for many reasons that were presented at that time, since I am now informed that his princely grace is inclined to seek me again out of special gracious will, I will, for his princely grace's humble satisfaction and for your love and honor, continue negotiations without hesitation at the appointed time. I did not want to withhold this response to your letter from you.
Given at Hallwil, the 18th of September in the year 1538.
To the well-learned, prudent, and wise Mr. Heinrich Bullinger, preacher of the city of Zurich, my beloved lord.
